data.title: Tuskegee University
data.text:
In Memorium

The Tuskegee University Family and the Office of Alumni Affairs extend heartfelt sympathy to the family and friends of our departed sons and daughters of Mother Tuskegee.

CLICK HERE FOR SUBMIT FORM

Lawrence Slatter II

passed away.on Jan. 27, 2023.

He earned his BS and MS degrees in Electrical Engineering at Tuskegee University. While at Tuskegee he met his future wife, Anne Jones, and participated in acts of social justice like the march from Selma to Montgomery and the 1968 student-lead drive to improve the campus conditions.He had a successful career at the Xerox Corporation that spanned 32 years.

Memorial Service: Saturday, February 25, 2023, 11:00 AM (CT)

at Hamilton Park United Methodist Church, 11881 Schroeder Rd, Dallas, Texas 75243. In lieu of flowers, donations can be made to Tuskegee University at this link:

https://www.tuskegee.edu/support-tu/give

or mail to:

Tuskegee University, Office of Advancement and Development

P.O. Box 1304, Tuskegee Institute, Alabama 36087.

Source: Black and Clark Funeral Home

Class of 1975

Johnson Haynes Jr., M.D.

Originally from Opelika, AL passed away in Mobile, AL on Dec.2, 2022.

After graduating from high school in 1971, he entered Tuskegee Institute, where he concentrated in pre-med studies and pledged the Alpha Phi Alpha fraternity. He graduated from medical school at the University of South Alabama in 1980 to begin a career as an African-American trailblazer, the first to train as a resident and a fellow at USA (Univ of South Ala Health). He joined the faculty in 1984 as the first African-American clinical and basic sciences faculty member. He was a devoted mentor to countless medical students and residents and a tireless advocate for more opportunities in medicine for students from disadvantaged communities. In September 2022, USA named its sickle cell center, which he headed since 2001, in his honor.

The Alpha Phi Alpha Omega service was held at 7 pm on Thur., December 8, at Small’s Mortuary at 950 S. Broad Street in Mobile. The funeral service was held at 10:30 am on Friday, December 9, at St. Paul’s Episcopal Church at 4051 on Old Shell Road. The burial service was held at 12 Noon on Sat, Dec. 10, at Garden Hills Cemetery in Opelika, Al. In lieu of flowers, the family asks that donations be made to the Johnson Haynes Jr. M.D. Comprehensive Sickle Cell Center, 650 Clinic

Drive, TRP III Ste. 1500, Mobile, AL 36688.

Smiley Bonds

Meridian, MS

(U.S. Navy honorable discharge)

Died: Tuesday, July 20, 2021

Graveside Services: for Mr. Smiley Bonds were held on Monday, July 26, 2021 at 2:00 p.m. at Forest Lawn Memorial Gardens with Rev. Trevelle McGlothin officiating. Berry and Gardner Funeral Home were entrusted with arrangements.

In lieu of flowers, the family requests that memorial donations be made to St. James A.M.E. Church, 3706 Davis Street, Meridian, MS 39307.

Visitation was held Sunday, July 25, 2021 from 4:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. at Berry and Gardner’s OP Chapel. Online condolences may be expressed at www.berryandgardner.com.

Class of ????

Clifford James Anderson

(Retired U.S. Army)

Died: Monday, Feb. 15, 2021

in Montgomery, AL

Celebration of Life Services and Interment with Military Honors: Held Saturday, February 27, 2021 at 11:00 am from the Elizabeth Missionary Baptist Cemetery of the Aberfoil Community.

He graduated from Carver High School, Montgomery, AL in 1967 and matriculated to Tuskegee Institute and Alabama State University.He was drafted into the United States Army where he served 12 years while being stationed in Iran, Germany, and the United States. He went on to work for the federal government for 35 years with positions at the United States Patent and Trade Office, the United States Postal Service, and the Veterans Administration Hospital. He retired in 2005 from federal service.

Class of 1964 or 65

Maj. James Edward Cooper

(Retired U.S. Air Force)

Died: Wednesday, Dec. 16, 2020

in Las Vegas, NV.

Memorial Service: February 1, 2021 at 11am (PST)

at LaPaloma Funeral Services, 5450 Stephanie St., Las Vegas, NV.

Interment: Southern Nevada Veterans Memorial Cemetery

After receiving a BS degree in Electrical Engineering from Tuskegee Institute (now University), he was commissioned as a First Lieutenant in the United States Air Force in August 1965. He served 22 years in the United States Air Force and was honorably discharged in 1987 at Nellis AFB, Las Vegas, Nevada. After retiring from active duty, Jim was an independent certified Cisco Ntework Administrator Trainer where he traveled throughout the U.S. teaching network certification courses.

Class of 1974

Dr. Cynthia Sellers-Simon

(former Vice President for Student

Affairs at Tuskegee University)

Died: Wednesday, October 14, 2020

As Vice President of Student Affairs at

Tuskegee University, she molded and

directed many students’ lives. She was

a proud TU alumna and was of great

service to Mother Tuskegee through her

giving as a proud gold presidential associate and member of the alumni association. She touched the lives of many students and was a trusted colleague,friend and professional who will be dearly missed.

Funeral Service:

Wednesday, October 21, 2020, 2:00 p.m. (EST)

Macon Memorial Park Chapel and Cemetery

3969 Mercer University Drive, Macon, Georgia 31204

Livestream:

https://www.legacy.com/amp/obituaries/

macon/196961447

Class of ????

David Calloway Ross Jr.

(president of Ross-Clayton Funeral Home, Montgomery, AL)

Died: Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2020

David Calloway Ross Jr., passed after a brief, non-COVID-19-related illness, the funeral home confirmed.

Ross, 72, was a lifelong Montgomery resident and U.S. Air Force veteran. He graduated from Tuskegee Institute and Gupton-Jones College of Mortuary Science and succeeded his father, David Calloway Ross Sr., as president of Ross-Clayton Funeral Home in 1978.

Ross is survived by his wife, Sarah Ann Ross, four children and one grandson.

Public visitation: Saturday Oct. 17, 2020 from

4:30 to 8:30 p.m. at Ross-Clayton Funeral Home.Chapel

Dorothea B. Walker

Died: April 13, 2020

She was a native of Alexander City, Alabama.

She is survived by her husband Frank Walker

and her children, Jason, Frank and Jamila.

She was a member of the Alexander City Board

of Education. Having previously worked with the

Alabama Department of Education, she was a

strong advocate for children.

Image courtesy of https://www.alexcityoutlook.com

2019 2018

Class of 1964

Rear Admiral (ret.) Mack C. Gaston

Died December 2, 2018 in Illinois

Memorial Service:

Wednesday, Dec. 12, 2018 at 2pm at

Village Church of Gurnee

1319 N. Hunt Club Road

Gurnee, IL 60031

Friday, Dec. 14, 2018 at 6pm at

Willis Funeral Home

2011 Martin Luther King, Jr. Drive

Dalton, GA 30721

Rear Admiral Gaston received a commission as an Ensign in the U.S Navy in December 1965. He had an impressive naval career spanning 31 years, including command of two destroyers and cruiser USS Josephus Daniels, and ashore as Commander Field Command, Defense Nuclear Agency and the first black Commander of Naval Training Center Great Lakes. He retired in 1995. Following retirement from the U.S. Navy, he pursued a successful corporate career at Waste Management, Inc. and Electronic Data Systems in senior executive positions.

He twice served as interim director of the Tuskegee University Golden Voices Concert Choir - 1990-1993 and 1999-2001.

He was also was the founding director of the William Levi Dawson Alumni Choir at Tuskegee University in 1990. Tuskegee University awarded him an honorary doctorate in 2010.

Memorial Service held during Homecoming weekend, Friday, October 21, 2016, 5:30pm, in the Tuskegee University Chapel.

William Reese and Son Mortuary, P.A.

Melvin D. Howard, D.V.M., worked with the Animal Control's

Rabies Clinic including the county's Animal Control

Commission and Commission for Women, and various

boards for veterinary medicine. He was the first African

American president of the Maryland State Board of

Veterinary Medical Examiners.

He had a practice in Annapolis, Md before his retirement.

In 2013 Dr. Howard received the Dallas G. Pace Sr.

Humanitarian Award, from the Anne Arundel County Human Relations Commission. Class of 1944??

Died June 26, 2016

in Richmond, VA

Memorial Service: August 20, 2016, 11am

at the Tuskegee University Chapel.

In the early 1960s he created HRDC, the Human Resources Development Center at Tuskegee (Institute) University and served as its first executive director. HRDC, the Extension Division of the university.

in Alabama and the southeast. He received several honors

and awards in recognition of his effort and contributions on improving the life of rural communities and African-Americans in the southern U.S. He was a 2012 inductee of the George Washington Carver Public Service Hall of Fame. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to:

the Tuskegee University College of Agriculture, Environment and Nutrition Sciences, the National Hospice Foundation and the Alzheimer’s Association. Class of 1955

Calvin Dudley

Died May 31, 2016

in San Antonio, Texas.

He joined the U.S. Air Force as a

Commissioned Officer and served

in Libya and Korea. After being

honorably discharged from the

military, Calvin moved to San Antonio and started his business as a general building contractor and

construction project manager. His career spanned over 60 years, and included two companies - The Dudley Corporation and a joint business with Col. Tom Beatty,

Cal-Tom Construction Company, whose construction projects included the Kelly Air Force Base, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Audie Murphy Memorial Veterans Hospital, and many others. Class of 1967

Earl H. Rippe, Jr.

Died June 24, 2016

in Camden, NJ

Earl H. Rippie, Jr. DVM Owner and Director of the Pennsauken Animal Hospital.

Interment: Whitworth Cemetery, Bell Buckle, TN next week. Celebration of Life: Saturday July 16th, 2016.

3pm at Browning-Hess Farm, 824 N. Lenola Rd,

Moorestown, NJ 08057. He was affiliated with Feline

Practioners, AVDS, NJVMA, AVMA, AAHA, ACVC,LAVC,

and the NAVC where he served on the board of directors, as president, & secretary-treasurer. Graveside Services held July 6, 2016 2pm at Houston-Whitworth Cemetery in Bell Buckle, TN.

In Lieu of flowers memorial donations can be made to the Pennsauken Animal Hospital- 6717 Crescent Blvd.

Pennsauken, NJ 08110. Class of ????

Died April 4, 2016

Funeral Service: April 8, 2016 at 10am at

Greater St. Mark Missionary Baptist Church

3403 W. Martin Luther King Highway

Tuskegee Institute, AL 36088

People's Funeral Home

500 Fonville Street, Tuskegee, AL.

Webster received his Doctor of Veterinary Medicine degree

from Tuskegee Institute. During his 39-yr tenure at Tuskegee University, Webster served as head of the Department of Biomedical Sciences (CVMNAH) from 1988-1999, associate dean for (CVMNAH) from 1993-1999, director of the Health Careers Opportunity grant (HCOP) from 2006-2013, and associate dean for student affairs and facility management (CVMNAH) from 2003-2014. He also taught veterinary physiology and cardiovascular research Class of 1980

Michelle "Mickey" Nannette Holloway

Died April 1, 2016

in Knoxville, TN

Visitation:Apr. 6, 2016 11am

At Weatherford Mortuary

Service: Apr. 6, 2016 12 pm

Rev. Aja Ward, Rev. Churchill Moore and Rev. Ron Lacy officiating. Interment will follow at Oak Ridge Memorial Park.

She then attended Tuskegee Institute where she received her Doctorate in 1980. After receiving her DVM, Mickey began practicing medicine in Elk Point, South Dakota with Dr. Sidney Milburn. She was also the official Veterinarian for the State of Iowa Racing Commission. In 1981 she moved to Trenton, New Jersey and resided there for the next 19 years. In 2000, Mickey retired from the State of New Jersey Department of Agriculture and returned to Oak Ridge. Class of 1992

Lizel Charmaine Salmon

Died January 9, 2016

in Maryland

In lieu of flowers, donations may be sent to the charity Lizel founded, The Animal Protection League, Inc , 3772 Glebe

Meadow Way, Edgewater, MD, 21037, and to The Wellness House of Annapolis, 2625 Mas Que Farm Road, Annapolis, MD. Along with her close friend and colleague from Tuskegee, Dr. Patricia Boyce, they took over the New Carrollton Veterinary Hospital in Lanham, MD. They soon transitioned the practice into their own brand of veterinary excellence which they renamed APAW. Class of 1948

Great Granddaughter of Booker T. Washington

Died on November 10, 2015

Memorial Service: November 23, 2015

at the Tuskegee University Chapel

Robin was an educator, author and motivational speaker. She graduated from Tuskegee Institute High School, class of 1968 and later earned her Master's degree from Tuskegee (Institute) University.

“It has become my life’s work to keep my great grandfather’s legacy alive by doing those things that will draw attention to his philosophies and his work.” Class of 1927

Amelia Platts Boynton Robinson

Died August 26, 2015

She was a Civil Rights pioneer and

longtime activist for human rights. She is best known as the woman in the iconic photo of the “Bloody Sunday” civil rights march. She was gassed and brutally beaten by law enforcement agents at the foot of the Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma, Ala., on March 7, 1965. During the 50th anniversary of the march, she returned and was

personally escorted across the bridge by President Barack Obama. The Smithsonian Institution National Museum of African American History and Culture in collaboration with the Tuskegee University Archives will preserve and share the legacy of this civil rights pioneer. Class of 1953

Died August 13, 2015

Cooley was also a two-time Tuskegee University alumna and founder of the Huntsville-Decatur Alumni Club. She was also a Distinguished Life Eminent/$1000 Plus Associate. She was Professor Emerita and former head of the Department of Counseling and Student Development at Tuskegee.

Dr. Cooper was appointed by President Barack Obama as executive director of the White House Initiative on Historically

Black Colleges and Universities. He served as former dean

of the Tuskegee University School of Applied Sciences from

1978-1985.

Funeral Service: June 9, 2015 at 1:00 pm

Tuskegee University Chapel

Tuskegee, AL

Albert "Al" Joyner was the brother of syndicated radio personality Tom Joyner, and he was a successful owner of several Jackson-area McDonald's franchises. He as a member of Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc. The Joyners run My Joy Inc., which is based in Ridgeland. Al Joyner and his wife, Danita are known for their philanthropic work. Class of 1949

Birmingham, AL

Funeral: June 18, 2015

Photo courtesy of Smith &Gaston Funeral Home Southside.

Coach Dickerson's coaching career began as a student

serving as assistant coach under Coach Cleve Abbott.

He met his wife, Mildred Thompson, while at Tuskegee. He received the Tuskegee University Merit

Award and was inducted into the Tuskegee University

Athletic Hall of Fame. He later became a member of the

Alabama Sports Hall of Fame.

Class of ______

Louis Adolph “Mike” Rabb

Died April 23, 2015

Rabb worked for four TU presidents during his 46-year tenure at the institution. He served as

administrator of the former John A. Andrew Hospital, secretary of the TU Board of Trustees under former Tuskegee president, Luther Foster and has also worked in the Office of the President as assistant to the president from 1974 to 1981. He was 101 years old.

awarded in the State of Alabama She was an educator,

civil rights pioneer and community activist. She and husband, Palmer Sullins Sr., were plaintiffs in the Gomillion v. Class of 1955 and 1969

Lt. Col. Herbert E. Carter

Died November 8, 2012

Funeral Service was held

November 15, 2012 at the

Tuskegee University Chapel.

Carter was a member of the

original cadre of the

99th Fighter Squadron of the Tuskegee Airmen.

One of the original Tuskegee Airmen who returned

to Tuskegee to celebrate the film premiere

of "Red Tails." Carter also served as asst. dean

and professor at Tuskegee University.

Carter's wife, Mildred Hemmons Carter died

the previous year on October 26, 2011.

Both being pilots, they held a mid-air courtship

that lasted for 68 years. Class of 1991

Class of 1970

Jock Smith

Died January 8, 2012

Tuskegee University Board of Trustees member and nationally acclaimed attorney. Jock Smith was a law partner of the late Johnnie L. Cochran Jr., and founder and senior partner in the national law firm Cochran, Cherry, Givens and Smith, with offices in Tuskegee, Los Angeles, New York, and other areas. Contributions should be made to the Jock Smith Memorial Scholarship Fund at Tuskegee University. 2011 Class of 1940

Mildred Hemmons Carter

Died October 26, 2011

She was the wife of

Lt. Col. Herbert Carter,

an original Tuskegee Airman.

Both being pilots, they held a mid-air

courtship that lasted for 68 years.

She was considered a part of the

Tuskegee Airmen Legacy because she

became the first female pilot to join the Alabama State's Civil

Air Patrol Squadron in 1942, and she was the first black

woman in Alabama to earn a pilot's license. Class of 1945

Jacksonville, FL

Surcey was a member of the Tuskegee Airmen and

received the Congressional Gold Medal in 2009.

He was husband of Future T. Surcey.

(Photo courtesy of Bob Self/Florida Times-Union) 2009 Class of 1965

Leonard H. Billups

Died October 28, 2009

Billups, DVM, was director of the Diagnostic

Laboratory Services and associate

professor of Pathology at the Tuskegee University College of Veterinary

Medicine, Nursing & Allied Health. Billups also served his country admirably as commander of the 422nd Medical Detachment, Rockville, Md. (1985-1989), and retired as Colonel of the United States Army Veterinary Corps, USAR in 1995. He returned to Tuskegee University to serve his alma mater as Associate Dean for Administration. 2007
